intro: Pisonia noxia var. typica, commonly known as the narrow-leaf pisonia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, where it thrives in humid, well-drained soils. Its flowers are often visited by birds and insects, contributing to its ecological significance. The species is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and floral display.
